title: Known Issues Utility: Agent-Logged Bug Fixes & Context Library
description: Build a utility system where agents log issues they encounter with their fixes and context. Creates a searchable, learnable database so future agents skip repeated debugging and have immediate solutions.
problem: Agents repeatedly encounter the same bugs, spend time debugging, discover the same fixes. No institutional knowledge transfer. Each agent starts from zero.
vision: Central known issues registry where agents (or orchestrator) log: issue description, error message, root cause, fix applied, prevention tips. Future agents query this before debugging.
use_case: Agent hits 'Python path not found' error → queries known-issues → finds 3 similar cases with solutions → applies fix immediately

what_gets_logged: Issue: Clear description of the problem
Error message: Exact error text or stack trace
Root cause: Why it happened (missing dependency, config, path, etc.)
Fix applied: Exact steps to resolve
Prevention: How to avoid it next time
Project/context: Which project, which tool, which environment
Tags: Error type, tool affected, severity (blocker/annoying/minor)
access_patterns: Query by tag (python, path, import, etc.)
Browse all issues for a tool/project
Sort by frequency (most common issues first)
workflow: If found: Agent applies known fix, no debugging needed
If not found: Agent debugs, discovers fix
System stores in registry for future agents

technical_considerations.storage: JSON files in coderef/known-issues/ (searchable, version-able, git-trackable)
integration_points: /known-issues search <query>  - Search by error message or keywords
/known-issues project <project>  - Show issues for specific project
/known-issues log-fix <details>  - Log a new issue + fix
/known-issues update <issue-id>  - Update frequency, last-seen for existing
Dashboard widget: Top 10 known issues in your projects

example_entry.title: Python not found in Windows PATH
example_entry.description: When running Python scripts via subprocess or shell commands on Windows, get 'python' is not recognized error even though Python is installed.
example_entry.error_message: 'python' is not recognized as an internal or external command, operable program or batch file.
example_entry.root_cause: Python installation not added to Windows PATH environment variable. System can't locate python.exe.
example_entry.fix:
1. Verify Python installed: python --version in CMD
2. Add Python to PATH: setx PATH '%PATH%;C:\Users\<user>\AppData\Local\Programs\Python\Python311'
3. Restart terminal/IDE
4. Verify: python --version
example_entry.prevention: When installing Python on Windows, check 'Add Python to PATH' during installation setup.

benefits: Knowledge transfer: Fixes preserved across agents and time
Speed: No repeated debugging of known issues
Learning: Agents see patterns (most common issues, prevention tips)
Accountability: Track who fixed what and when
Metrics: Identify systemic issues (repeated same bug = real problem)
Training: New agents can pre-learn common pitfalls
success_criteria: ✅ Known issues can be logged by agents or orchestrator
✅ Issues can be searched by error message, tag, project
✅ System returns matching issues with fixes immediately
✅ Frequency tracking shows most common issues
✅ Dashboard shows top issues per project
✅ Slash commands exist: /known-issues search, log-fix, top, etc.
✅ Integration with agent workflows (suggest fixes when error encountered)
next_steps: Design issue entry schema (what fields are needed?)
Build slash commands: search, log-fix, update, top
Build search/query logic (text search, tag filtering, sorting)
Add dashboard widget for top issues
Integrate with error handling (suggest fixes when agents hit errors)
notes: This is institutional knowledge that compounds over time. First few weeks will be sparse, but after months of agent work, becomes invaluable troubleshooting resource. Consider this an investment in agent productivity and reliability.
